etymologies: late 18th century; earliest use found in Statute 32 George III. Blend of quercine and citron [adjective]

definitions: The inner bark of the American black oak, Quercus velutina, used as a source of the yellow dye quercitrin and in tanning (more fully "quercitron bark").
More fully "quercitron oak". The black oak, Quercus velutina, of eastern North America.
